info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 2:57PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Wasatch... southeastern Salt Lake and northwestern Utah Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 257 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Eagle Mountain, or 15 miles northwest of Provo, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sandy, Lehi, Draper, Pleasant Grove, Cottonwood Heights, Holladay, American Fork, Eagle Mountain, Lindon, Alpine, Bluffdale, Vineyard, Little Cottonwood Canyon, Granite, Little Cottonwood Creek Valley, Big Cottonwood Canyon, Mount Olympus, Mill Creek Canyon, Wasatch Mountain State Park and Camp Williams. This includes Interstate 15 between mile markers 274 and 292. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
